meaning: Hatred or distrust of people in general.
sentences: He is an acute thinker and observer, misled by his systematic misanthropy and by his fantastic literary theories.
It is modern misanthropy that diminishes Osmond's soul, not scientific rationalism.
Few books have added so much to the innocent mirth of mankind of the first two parts of Gulliver; the misanthropy is quite overpowered by the fun.
